title: After Violence, the Precious Work Begins
sub_head: What do surgeons think when a wounded child is wheeled in?
body:
When the shooting stops and the sirens fade, the precious, prayerful work begins.
“If they were still conscious and were looking me in the eye, I would hold their hands and try to reassure them,” said John G. Raffensperger. “I knew how afraid they were, so I would tell them that we were going to do our best to fix them.”
